Dear Ms. Brewer:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• Indicate how continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• Be signed and dated.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty
to perform the prescribed functions required by these
administrative rules and in the agency’s program statement
and to provide for the continual needs, protection, and
supervision of residents:
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A has experienced derogatory and threatening statements
from other youth, reported it to staff and has not seen any
response.
Investigation The Complainant was interviewed over the phone on 06/07/2024.
She was able to review notes taken during the meeting with Youth
A which prompted the report of these allegations and did not have
any additional information to provide.
Youth A was interviewed during an unannounced, face-to-face
visit at the facility on 03/13/2024. Youth A confirmed she informed
the Complainant of the allegations to be called in. She stated she
had been placed at the facility for about a month. Youth A
expressed concern with a group of youth placed at the facility
when she first came that have all since moved out. She
expressed she felt much better about those youth all being out of
the program and better about the current youth placed. Youth A
described several incidents over the previous month where she
felt threatened by other youth in the program. These involved
personal threats to herself, her property as well as racist
comments. One example occurred when other youth that Youth A
chose not to name, had made racist comments to her while she
was in her bedroom. Youth A stated Supervisor 1 was present,
and she addressed the other youth. Another example occurred
when there was an escalated incident in the program and Youth A
was shoved by Youth B. Youth A stated she told the Chief
Administrator about this incident. She clarified she did not feel in
danger after this occurred because of staff that were present.
Youth A described a third instance when she was getting in the
van with other youth as they were going to be transported
somewhere. She recalled being told to climb into the backseat by
2

Youth C, who then reached back and attempted to slap her.
Youth A recalled the Chief Administrator being present when this
occurred, and Youth C was addressed directly by her. Youth A
described another occasion where there was discord in the facility
because Youth B refused to be placed in the same bedroom as
Youth A during Youth A’s first couple of days in the placement.
Youth A believed she heard Youth B state to a staff member that
she would “just kill her in her sleep” if Youth B had to stay in that
same bedroom as Youth A. Youth A could not recall which staff
this was. She then clarified she did not share a bedroom with
Youth B from that point onward. Youth A described one more
instance when she was accused by other youth in the program of
stealing some of the personal items of Youth D. Youth A admitted
to making threatening statements to Youth D and Youth D stating
in response she would stab Youth A in her sleep. Youth A
believed Supervisor 1, or the Chief Administrator were present for
this interaction and they intervened quickly. For all of the
incidents described, Youth A stated staff were present and
intervened. She expressed displeasure that all it felt like they did
was document what occurred, intervene verbally, and make
moves within the home such as changing bedrooms and
enhancing supervision. She recalled staff, although she could not
recall who, telling her she could try her best to ignore those
comments by other youth and they encouraged all of the youth to
avoid these verbal statements and not let things escalate to
physical incidents. Youth A could not provide any further details
on dates or other youth involved in any of the incidents she
described. She also stated each incident involved a staff member
who was present and supervising herself and other youth, as well
as intervening verbally when there were behaviors of concern.
Youth A stated she was aware of the availability of a grievance
process at the facility, but she had not filed any grievances.
DHHS Foster Care Worker was interviewed over the phone on
03/19/2024. She was the assigned caseworker for Youth A. She
stated she had been made aware of several incidents involving
Youth A and other youth in the program since Youth A’s
placement began. DHHS Foster Care Worker did not have any
concern that staff had not responded appropriately to any
escalated incidents involving her youth. She reported she had
been to the facility and saw Youth A the day prior and no specific
concerns from Youth A were shared with her during their private
conversation.
The Chief Administrator was interviewed on 04/24/2024 during a
face-to-face visit to the facility. She reported being involved in
3

several instances of escalation and discord between Youth A and
other youth in the program. She recalled an instance when Youth
B attempted to push Youth A in front of herself and law
enforcement when they were on the premises, and intervention
occurred promptly. The Chief Administrator also recalled a time
when Youth A was getting in the facility car with other youth to go
on an outing. Youth A was verbally aggressive with the other
youth, and she believed it was Youth C who responded physically
by hitting Youth A. The Chief Administrator confirmed she
witnessed this from outside the car and intervened by asking
Youth A to get out of the car so she could address Youth C. She
believed Youth A stayed back at the house with another staff as a
result. The Chief Administrator did not believe there were any
examples of times when a situation between Youth A and others
required staff attention or intervention and that did not occur.
Youth C was interviewed on 06/06/2024 over the phone. She
confirmed she was no longer placed at the facility but recalled
interactions with Youth A while still placed there. Youth C did not
believe there were any situations where staff were not present and
did not try to involve themselves when she or other youth became
upset with Youth A. Youth C recalled an example of this where
Youth A said something derogatory to another youth that she
could not recall, and in response Youth C stated something
derogatory back to Youth A. Youth C stated there was a staff
member right there who interrupted them, although she could not
recall who that was.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed over the phone on 06/06/2024.
She stated she does not work at the facility anymore, but she
recalled Youth A’s placement at the program when she was still
employed. Supervisor 1 stated she was involved in several
instances of discord or escalation between Youth A and other
youth, and she believed these were all handled properly. She
could not recall specifically who, but she stated there was a time
when Youth A and another youth were arguing, and it rose to the
level of the use of derogatory and racial language and Supervisor
1 attempted to stop the argument by splitting up the youth.
Youth B was interviewed on 06/07/2024 over the phone. She
recalled being placed at the facility at the same time as Youth A.
Youth B did not have any concerns over staff’s attention and
intervention any time there was any escalation between she and
Youth A, or any other youth. Youth B recalled one example where
she and Youth A were trying to fight each other, and the Chief
4

Administrator and law enforcement were already present and
stopped the situation.
Documents reviewed:
• Policy & procedures from the facility were reviewed. In the
“Behavioral Management & Support Plan”, “Staff
Handbook” and “Resident Handbook” there are no specific
policies outlined that state anything other than verbal
redirection, safety planning, and a points based system of
behavior management will be used to address behavior
concerns of residents. The facility does not utilize an
approved restraint model or any physical management of
youth.
Analysis Through interviews with the youth involved and documentation
reviewed there was no evidence found that the facility was not
providing proper supervision or intervention between the youth
placed.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Privacy and confidentiality.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4130
Section (1) An institution shall assure resident and parent privacy and
Description confidentiality and shall protect residents from
exploitation.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth A's confidentiality was violated when speaking with a
mental health provider.
Investigation During the 03/13/2024 interview with Youth A at the facility, the
youth reported she had been on the phone with her therapist
when the consultant arrived. It was witnessed that a staff member
who could not be identified was standing outside the door of the
visitation room located on the first floor of the building. Youth A
came out of visitation room, where the door was open. Youth A
stated she had been on the phone with a therapist she had been
receiving services from prior to her placement at the program and
had been able to continue receiving services despite the new
placement. Youth A stated it had been her experience in the
program that all phone calls were required to be on speaker
5

phone with a staff member in the nearby vicinity so they could be
supervised. This included phone contact with family and mental
health providers. Youth A stated she was uncomfortable with this
requirement, and she believed it negatively affected her
conversations with her therapist.
The Chief Administrator was interviewed on 03/07/2024 during a
previously announced, face-to-face visit at the facility. During this
interview she stated the facility had taken on a policy that all
phone calls for youth were to be supervised. This included family
and mental health providers. The Chief Administrator expressed
concern over instances when youth had used phone call times to
contact inappropriate individuals who were not on their approved
phone call lists.
Documents reviewed:
• Policy and procedures for the facility were reviewed. In a
section titled “Communications” in the “Resident Handbook”
last dated 06/18/2023, stated “All youth calls will always be
supervised by staff and will take place on speaker phone.”
Analysis Through interviews with youth and staff and documentation
reviewed, there was evidence found that facility policy was too
restrictive, not allowing for reasonable privacy and breaking the
confidentiality of youth receiving outside mental health services
while placed at the program.
Conclusion Violation Established
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Based on the findings in this report a CAP is required.
Per SIR #2024C0001037SI, a 1st provisional license is recommended.
